channel.title: The Vampires [Faction]
channel.description: ># [color=03fcba]The Vampire Lord[/color] >[color=03fcba]Vampire Special[/color] > >**Bite (Night) -** Turn someone into a vampire. They will remain exactly the same; only their faction will change. Max 2 vampires alive at once. No cooldown. Works on all players. If you die, the other vampire will take your place. > >If you bite a healed played, they will be attacked and healed instead. If you bite a bear, you die. If you bite a defended target, you die to the knight, etc. > >There can be **Vampire Prince***, **Vampire King**, **Vampire Alchemist**, **Vampire Reaper**, etc. > >Sheriffs and Paladins may both spawn in Vampire games and their abilities work on Vampires similarly to how they work on Unseen and Cult. > >***Vampire Prince** won't meet with the **Vampire Lord** at night unless he decides to jail nobody.

item.title: The Vampires [Faction]
item.dc:creator: Napoleon
item.description:
ToL tried to make Cult a third-party faction a long time ago and it didn’t work out. For one, I don’t think a third-party faction would fit well into the game. Second of all, convert immunes should be immune to conversion.

Read full topic

item.title: The Vampires [Faction]
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
The reason this faction is underpowered is the fact that sheriffs and paladins can both spawn in this game. They start with one member compared to the standard 2. They have less KPN then both cult and unseen and them having less KPN when they only start with 1 member is absurd, being able to convert people who are immune does not make up for this fact nor will it ever. Not even letting the faction infinite convert will make up for this

This class can be screwed by a random n1 knight defend or death.

Read full topic

item.title: The Vampires [Faction]
item.dc:creator: JakeTheWolfie
item.description:
Shrimpy:

you can bite him and make him vampire king

No. No no no no NO! KING SHOULD NEVER BE ABLE TO BE CONVERTED! (Possessor is borderline converting, but it’s also a bad play)

Shrimpy:

literally anybody can be converted (bitten)

Turns a vampire into a vampire

But also, why would this need to be a thing? Neutrals don’t need to be converted, and a Neutral Killer sided with any faction would be OP.

Shrimpy:

how is it unbalanced?

For one, Evil Prince.

Shrimpy:

sellsword is neut and scum so …

So are Neutral Killers. And Scorned. And Fool. And any neutral that can be considered “bad” to the BD.

Read full topic

item.title: The Vampires [Faction]
item.dc:creator: DatBird
item.description:
So this is a faction right, similiar to Unseen and Cult. If BD is smart enough, they can lynch and Prince exe both in one night to get rid of the whole faction, now I hear you saying, well that can happen with any faction they only start with two, but, the big but is that they convert night 1. So… if BD are smart, this faction can be wiped Day 2/N2 since prince exe is at night, while unlike the Cult and Unseen they have the convert to hold the house down. Plus the lack of a kpn, means your best bet is to find killers, but if this were to be introduced killers would be smart enough to only claim to prince/mystic/king. Also the fact you can convert Neutrals is against the point of a neutral, they were made to be not converted, most of their abilities prove almost no significant help to a Vampire lord. Wow a Fool can get himself detected and trollbox, a SS can make it so only attacks go through, oh wait we dont have a killer since I recuited the SS. The only ones that would be worth it are NKs, but just like prince and King they are uuncovertable by nature, and making them convertable is weird and against everything present in the game atm. Also just a major gripe in general is he lack of a Vampire version of Sheriff/Paladin for me. The fact can either spawn makes misinformation spread on what type of game it is.

If I were you and wanted to flesh this out, I would make the Vampire Lord stronger, decide if I wanted this to be smaller faction like the cult where the class type matters and not the specific role, or Unseen like where everyone has a convert. I would also recomend a second in command if its more like Unseen, like Assassin, to make the other person worth while if you converted a a less than average class. I would raise the cap and put the convert on cooldown to match the system of the other factions. Lastly I would make the unconvertables stay unconverted, and add an new Invest that has some new abilities to help find them. A vampire Hunter would be a cool name for it

Read full topic
